text: Gregory McIntosh "Gerg" Robinson (October 9, 1951 â€“ January 5, 2022) was an American football coach and player. Robinson was the head football coach at Syracuse University from 2005 to 2008. He was an assistant coach with several other college football programs and for three teams in the National Football League (NFL): the New York Jets from 1990 to 1994, the Denver Broncos from 1995 to 2000, and the Kansas City Chiefs from 2001 to 2003. He was born in Los Angeles, California.
